Uses of Class
com.flowpowered.commons.store.block.AtomicBlockStore.DataMask

  • Packages that use AtomicBlockStore.DataMask 
    Package Description
    com.flowpowered.commons.store.block  
    com.flowpowered.commons.store.block.impl  

    • Uses of AtomicBlockStore.DataMask in com.flowpowered.commons.store.block

      Methods in com.flowpowered.commons.store.block with parameters of type AtomicBlockStore.DataMask 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int AtomicBlockStore.getAndSetBlock(int x, int y, int z, short id, short data, AtomicBlockStore.DataMask mask)
      Sets the block id, data for the block at (x, y, z).

      If the data is 0, then the block will be stored as a single short.
      The data mask will be used to update only the desired bits.
      short AtomicBlockStore.getData(int x, int y, int z, AtomicBlockStore.DataMask mask)
      Gets the block data for a block at a particular location, applying the provided mask and shift to extract it from the raw data.
      short[] AtomicBlockStore.getDataArray(AtomicBlockStore.DataMask mask)
      Gets a short array containing the block data for the blocks in the store.

      If the store is updated while this snapshot is being taken, data tearing could occur.
      short[] AtomicBlockStore.getDataArray(short[] array, AtomicBlockStore.DataMask mask)
      Copies the block data in the store into an array.

      If the store is updated while this snapshot is being taken, data tearing could occur.

      If the array is the wrong length or null, a new array is created.
      void AtomicBlockStore.setBlock(int x, int y, int z, short id, short data, AtomicBlockStore.DataMask mask)
      Sets the block id and data for the block at (x, y, z).

      If the data is 0, then the block will be stored as a single short.
      The data mask will be used to update only the desired bits.
      void AtomicBlockStore.setData(int x, int y, int z, short data, AtomicBlockStore.DataMask mask)
      Sets the block data for the block at (x, y, z).
